entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued May 23 at 9:34PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surf heights of 10 to 12 feet tonight will build to 11 to 14 feet on Tuesday. Highest surf will be on south and east facing shores. * TIMING...through Saturday * IMPACTS...Large surfs and strong rip currents.

entry.summary: ...Red Flag Warning for Gusty Wind and Low Humidity Continues through Wednesday Morning... .Breezy northerly wind combined with low relative humidity will continue areas of critical fire weather conditions today through Wednesday morning. entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 8:54AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding as a result of 2 to 3 inches of rain that fell across the Roanoke area and upstream basins overnight and early this morning. * WHERE...City of Roanoke, especially the downtown area and areas adjacent to the Roanoke River and its tributaries.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 8:16AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Several hours of rain occurred overnight producing rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches across the region, impacting Wolf Creek and Mill Creek as well as the general area around Narrows where these two creeks flow into the New River. Low lying, poor drainage, and normally flood prone areas may be flooded for the next several hours as a result. Along the Wolf Creek at Narrows, the stage at 8 AM EDT
